# canGoForward

**Instance Property**

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the next page in the page history.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var canGoForward: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The page history gets built as your application calls navigation methods such as [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFView/go(to:)-5lh5d] and [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFView/goToLastPage(_:)].

## Related Documentation

- **goForward(_:)**: Navigates forward one step in the page history.

## Determining Valid History Operations

- **canGoBack**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the previous page in the page history.
- **canGoToFirstPage**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the first page of the document.
- **canGoToLastPage**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the last page of the document.
- **canGoToNextPage**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the next page of the document.
- **canGoToPreviousPage**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the previous page of the document.
